text: [Music]
I'm Jonathan Pritchard I'm a professor
of genetics and biology at Stanford
University my family moved to the US
when I was in high school and uh I went
to Penn State which has uh a great
program in evolutionary biology and I I
got interested in evolutionary biology
there um and from there I I came to
Stanford for grad school and then I went
on to uh to Oxford to learn statistical
genetics and then after Oxford I had my
first faculty job at the University of
Chicago I spent 12 years there and uh um
but I always had in mind that it would
be great to come back to Stanford if the
opportunity arose so I just came back
half a year ago this is just an
incredibly exciting time to be in
genetics because technology has
completely changed the kinds of
questions that we can ask compared to
even 10 years ago um so all of these
genome Wide Technologies are giving us a
window into um all sorts of aspects of
genome function and variation across
individuals and across species that we
had no chance of of tackling even very
recently it's a incredibly important to
learn programming and to um become
really good at dealing with large
amounts of data because the future of
the field is an understanding uh huge
amounts of data and making sense of it
on the other hand you also really need
to understand biology so for people who
are coming from a programming background
then I would really encourage them to um
dive into understanding molecular bi
biology and genetics at a really deep
level because you need to have both
sides of the coin to to be a good
[Music]
geneticist
